channel.title: Ahh - Windows Genuine Advantage
channel.description:
I was away working for a few days and when I got back my mum had been on my laptop and run the genuine advantage without thinking. Now my PC is stuck with the shit you get when it finds out you have a counterfeit copy of Windows.
My question is - Do I have to do a complete reinstall of Windows or is there a way around this?
Any advice would be much appreciated.
Cheers guys!

item.title: Ahh - Windows Genuine Advantage
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

la­wl:

my uni gives it out free so do most

This. I know my university is part of the MSDN academic software alliance, which means I could get professional versions of virtually everything you could want from microsoft, free of charge.

@Cumescape:
With regards to $200+, or any arbitrary amount of money for that matter, being cheap: If you’re upper middle class or upper class then good for you; dropping $200 into something that can be obtained (albeit illegally) for free isn’t going to break your budget.
Unfortunately this isn’t the case for a lot of people who, as students with concessions that you quite clearly overestimate the value of, find themselves living on $1.20 oatmeal packets, pasta, and rice and still struggling to pay the rent each week.
I’m glad mummy and daddy still bankroll your fun and games; it’s great that you haven’t found yourself tightening your metaphorical spending belt so that you can make rent, afford that car insurance/registration payment, or afford $100+ textbooks that, in Australia at least and strangely enough, aren’t covered by the government in student loans.

Not everyone has heaps of money. Take the hint that has been dropped by previous posters and fuck off already. I’m so sick of you trying to take the piss out of people because they can’t afford expensive silverware and 10 ply toilet paper.

Read full topic
